Pre-Game Insights: The Detroit Tigers, on a three-game home winning streak, host the Tampa Bay Rays.
Detroit has gone 41-36 in home games and 84-74 overall.
The Tigers have a 36-5 record in games when they hit at least two home runs.
Tampa Bay has a 78-80 record overall and a 36-41 record in road games.
The Rays have a 52-11 record in games when they out-hit their opponents.
Thursday's game is the sixth meeting between these teams this season.
The Tigers are up 4-1 in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Riley Greene has a.264 batting average to lead the Tigers, and has 26 doubles, six triples and 24 home runs.
Parker Meadows is 10-for-41 with two home runs and three RBI over the past 10 games.
Christopher Morel has 11 doubles, three triples and 21 home runs for the Rays.
Jonathan Aranda is 8-for-31 with three home runs over the last 10 games.
BETMGM SPORTSBOOK: LINE Tigers -162, Rays +137; over/under is 7 1/2 runs
Others: PITCHING PROBABLES: Rays: Tyler Alexander (6-5, 5.35 ERA, 1.27 WHIP, 84 strikeouts); Tigers: Reese Olson (4-8, 3.49 ERA, 1.19 WHIP, 98 strikeouts)
INJURIES: Tigers: Alex Faedo: 60-Day IL (shoulder), Javier Baez: 60-Day IL (hip), Brendan White: 60-Day IL (elbow), Sawyer Gipson-Long: 60-Day IL (groin)
Rays: Jeffrey Springs: 15-Day IL (elbow), Peter Anderson Fairbanks: 15-Day IL (shoulder), Jacob Waguespack: 60-Day IL (shoulder), Shane McClanahan: 60-Day IL (forearm)
